channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2023080180
item.description:
Report X-2023080180

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET. UPON INSPECTION, ALL BOTTLES HAD LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAPS; SOME HAD BEEN SQUISHED. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED. DescribePack: ALL BOTTLES LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

item.title: Report X-2023080066
item.description:
Report X-2023080066

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package that contained a plastic container of ethanol. The box was wet and stained from the container having a loose cap and caused a spill. Stained all over itself and on box. DescribePack: Box was stained from dried up ethanol spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag inside a plastic bin with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2023080065
item.description:
Report X-2023080065

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package containing 2 ink cartridges. The box was stained of black ink. One of the cartridges spilled ink due to an open or broken compartment. Inks stained other cartridge but does not look like it is also damaged. Both cartridges are basically not usable. DescribePack: Box was stained with black in all over. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag inside a plastic bin with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2023071119
item.description:
Report X-2023071119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: NILES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was set aside because it was torn open and the sides look like they were wet at one point and now are dry. Upon inspection I could see that all 4 bottles of corrosive liquid had loose caps causing contents to spill. Package was placed in a plastic to stop further spillage. DescribePack: Tops failed and leaked contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in plastic tote.

item.title: Report X-2023071107
item.description:
Report X-2023071107

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: DANVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Had Fell and the top of the bocket had came loose causing about 8 ounces of fluid to leak. Fluid was Cleaned with PH neutralizer using proper ppe. Package was taken to hazmat area in proper packing as fast as possible. DescribePack: LID DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bucket was put under flow hood, and excess was properly cleaned.

item.title: Report X-2023071070
item.description:
Report X-2023071070

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in RORS unload leaking and stained. Package smelled of alcohol and had Flammable HazMat labeling. Package was immediately called out on the radio and picked up by QA. Package was taken out of the load areas and isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: 1 of the 6 available cans inside the box had a leaking cap, and its can was also badly bent in multiple areas. Item was bent near the top, and also at the bottom. Item leaked from its cap. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2023071052
item.description:
Report X-2023071052

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

item.title: Report E-2023070784
item.description:
Report E-2023070784

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN1197 Caramel Flavoring release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released impacting a 1' x 1' area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum and one cubic yard box. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
